Choices:  A: utah B: south america C: new hampshire D: japan E: new mexico<n><n>### Response:		D: Japán.<n><n>### Description: <n><n>When Richard is 40, he will be 20 years older than Hurley (by that time Hurley will be 60). Then 100 - 20 = 80 = 10 Years, so that they are 40years older by that time together = (14 + 40) = 14 = 12 years old when he is 128.<n><n>In this question is not said how many pages is the page, only the cent the boy’s mom will pay per page, then he will read 80% and 60% per p. and if he reads the half of the pages the whole page is worth (100%) each, then divide all pages that he will read by two to get all the pages (56pages x 0.5 =28pages).<n><n>So $15 = (\frac22 x 28) =14pages \Rightarrow 14pages x $0.01 = $0.14.<n><n>So after read $0.15 x 40=$40 dollars and the rest $0.14 x 40 = 5.60 dollars, then he has to save $45.60 so the rest is $3. Then each of the two pages he will read will cost $0.14$, so to save $45$ he is going to read 4 pages<n><n><n>In that question we will take the first answer it is said the boy will save money to buy the candy, so he buys all that he needs to have a equal price to the total of the ones they read, so all pages x $\frac22$ will have the same price that the total of money that he is saving = $\frac22$ x $Page$ = Total of that money.<n><n>If he read $Page$ x 15$ =$ Page \times \frac43 (2 pages are equal to one cent) =TotalPrice. So each page is worth $Page$ x 25 = $Page$ \times 5.<n><n>**Input :**If I wanted<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Design a function, where the value of the function depends on the length of a string. Example input for the ‘test’

If the next letter is an 'L', you can't.<n><n>### Rule:<n>If the next letter is an `s` then you can add it to the word.<n><n>### Rules:<n>This game can be played in teams or one on one.<n><n>### Objective:<n><n>### Input<n>The rules of this game are easy to understand.<n><n>### What is the objective of this word game? Choices: A. To get a word with no vowels B. To use all letters C. To find a word for the whole team. D. To form a valid English word using the letters shown.<n><n>### Response<n>The object of the word game is to find words that use the letters you have to form a valid English words<n><n>### Input What are the rules to the word game? Choices A: Only words with seven letters are allowed B: The team with the most words wins C: Spelling is not a factor D: Two teammates cannot share a word<n><n>### Response The rules of the game are simple, if you are playing with an S, and the next letter is another S, then you can add it. If they are sharing one word and adding it they just add it to their own word.<n><n>## Author: kimharris19<n><n>## Last Updated: Wednesday, June 13 2010 1:33:40 PM

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:Where do fish spend the majority of their time? Choices:  A: body of water B: lake superior C: underwater D: toilet E: aquarium<n><n>### Response:		A<n>### Demonstraion:<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Response<n><n><n><n>### Input <n><n>### Response <n><n><n><n>## Solution<n><n>```<n>#include <iostream><n>using namespace std;<n><n>int main() {<n>	cin >> N, M;<n>	int sum;<n>	int* arr = new int[N];<n>	for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {<n>		arr[i] = i;<n>	}<n><n>	for (int j = 1; j <= N; j++) {<n>		sum += arr[j] * j;<n>	}<n>	cout << sum % M; <n><n>	for (auto it = 0; it < *N/2; ++it) {<n>		cout << arr[it] << "\n";<n>	}<n>	return 0; <n>}<n>```<n><n>---<n># Challenge<n><n>The question is about two different ways to implement a function. The first solution is the correct way, the other is the wrong solution. Determine which function was implemented correctly, and explain your answer.<n><n>If both solutions are correct, provide the reasons for this.<n><n>### Input -<n><n>```<n>4 6<n>8<n>4<n>5<n>1 4<n>2<n>1 5<n>2 4<n>2 5<n>1<n>3 4<n>```<n><n><n><n>## Solutions<n><n>| 1    | 2 |<n>| ---- | -- |<n>| 6    | 4 |<n>| 1    + 4 = 5    |<n>| 5    - 5 = 0    |<n>| 1  - 1  == 0    |<n><n>| 1     | 2    |<n>| ----- | ----- |<n>| 4,    | 1     |<n>| 8     + 4 = 12  |<n>| 4     - 4 = 0   |<n>| 1     + 4 =  5   |<n>| 2     - 1 = 1   |<n><n>---<n># Solution<n><n>## Demonstration<n><n><n>## Input

I say that you  divide the difference in age between Richard and Herley by 2 to get <n>their combined ages 40 yers from now. Since 40+40=80, and since 40 ÷ 2 = 20. Then you simply add there combined ages 40 40 yers ago (40+40) to get their combiend ages fourty yers from now.<n><n><n>	Input:<n>Answer :<n>4. A.<n><n>	Exploration:<n>A:<n>The meaning of trivial is meaningless, unimportant or inconsequential. Thus it is inadequate as a means of socializing.<n><n>	Experiement:<n>I would say :<n>- We are talking about the same kind of socializing, but trivial conversations are not always meaningless and/or useless. Thus they often have a lot of practical uses.<n><n><n>### Input :<n>if you socialize by having conversations with people you do not know very well or at all then what do you do. The ship's hold isn't fast and also it's expensive to ship and it can't transport small cargo well.<n>## B. B, boat, because it's fast, but it's cheap, you can transport and ship good, but you can't transport small items.<n>## C. D, Car, because it's cheap, transport and ship good, and fast. This sort should be performed before the script, not after the sort.<n><> G. The characters are stored in a CSV file. The column will contain a word in all uppercase letters. If the name is lowercase, replace all lowercase letters with uppercase letters and sort. Use the column in place of the line of text.<n><> H. Output should only be printed and should not be used as part of any other function or assignment that may be part of the script. <n><> K. The sort will be performed on ASCII value so that you can

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:What would humans do when their legs are tired? Choices:  A: sit down B: make mistakes C: have sex D: reproduce E: excrete<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choices:  B, D <n>[Grammar points](https://github.com/shi000512/CS575-AI-Group1/tree/master/Wk03#grammar-points) <n><n><n>#### Easier than the others<n>You can ask about the human legs being tired and you will get C. This choice could be a hint of'sex'. Also, you can ask about 'how long is it going to take when the legs are tired.' For this case, the output will be C too. <n>Then you can give other hints: <n>`when people run and stop, what does he do next?` Choices: sit down B; make mistakes C; have sex D; reproduce E; excrete <n>Or...<n>`The tires on their legs are sore in the night, what do they do most at their legs`? Choices: A: sit down B; sit on a chair C; make mistakes D; have sex or reproduce at their legs E; excrete. <n><n>#### Difficult question <n>The above question was an easy one so you can get 0% accuracy. When I tried the test question, it does not work well. So the main problem is that you have to give hints very well or else you will get low score.<n><n>The instruction in the test question is: "A: 1; B: 1; C: 0.16; D: 2; E: 0.08; What value is closest to the true value?" <n><n>I gave the following multiple choices to answer the instruction. <n><n>`The boss has 4 employees, one of the employees' age is 20. What is the average age of all employees?`<n><n>Answer choices: A: 22; B: 20; C: 21; D: 21.16<n><n>And,<n><n>`At what temperature would it take for an ice cube to melt? Choices: A: 0; B: 25; C: 32; D: 45; E: -20; F: 132`.<n><n>And I got all of the choices, 0% accuracy.  I tried another choice.  <n><n>`The baker in our grocery has two workers

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:Where is disease often spread but shouldn't be? Choices:  A: ghost town B: third world country C: human body D: rug E: hospital<n><n>### Response:		Choice C<n><n>### Example Input<n>```<n>Human Body<n>```<n>### Example Output<n>```<n>Human body<n>```<n><n>#### How to complete the solution<n><n>You will be asked 2 questions (input).<n><n>You must input each question using the code `print("Human body")` if the answer is `C`.<n><n>You will be expected to enter your output to a new line in the terminal.<n><n>**How to enter your input and output in the terminal:**<n><n>If you're using a PC, type your input as usual on the console (press [Enter], it's similar to a keyboard). To enter your output, press the _<kbd>Enter</kbd>_ + _<kbd>CTRL+L</kbd>_ button.<n><n>Make sure your terminal is displaying your input, so you can copy-paste if necessary.<n><n>**How much you get paid for input?**<n><n>You get 1 ETH after correct answer.<n><n>**How you will be paid for output?**<n><n>You can earn some tokens from a pool of **ETH**, **USDT**, **WEB 3**.<n><n>Example, You get 50 BNB after correct answer for this task.

Choices:  A: tropics B: nightmare C: wyoming D: bushes E: feild<n><n>### Response:		<n>A is the only answer.<n><n>### Inputs:Input1: What is 2 more than 75 minus the number of words in the following sentence:I have eaten two 8 ounce pizzas and a half dozen bagels?<n>Answer: 4<n>Input2: What is 5 more than the number of words in a sentence that contained the following words: I ate one scone?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:"Whats your age?" he asked. I am not that old,he said looking sad to all his friends. But he is 8 years old,his mother said.<n><n>### In response:<n>"Whats your age?" she asked. I am not yet that age, she said, glaring at her mother.<n><n>The word is "her"<n><n>### Input1: 2,500,000 divided by 200=<n><n>### Answer1:<n>12,500<n><n>### Input2: 2000 divided by $0.20=<n><n>Output: 100<n><n>## Tests<n><n><n><n>### Your Task<n>Write a function that appropriately completes each request by writing an array of words that fits each description. <n><n>### Instructions for the Task<n>Complete the tests. Use testing strategies that involve your classmates as your target audience. Use the `return` keyword to finish the `tests` function. <n><n>    tests:  function(array){<n>        var str = "Your mommy's cat is really fat";<n><n>        /// write the code for your classmates to execute!<n>        // write your code below<n><n>        /// write it here, but don't forget to add return at the end<n>        // return "my cat is not fat!";<n>    },<n><n>```<n>Example: <n>```<n>> tests(["cat", "is", "not", "fat"]) <n>     [ "my cat is not", "not fat" ]<n>```<n>     ```<n>[ "not fat" ] <n>```<n><n>### Instructor Notes<n>If you look at this function, you can see that the function returns an array: if you remove the `return` keyword at the bottom, you will get an error message. <n>  <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:Where would you hear a viola along side many other string and brass instruments? Choices:  A: symphony B: band C: create music D: orchestra E: string quartet<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Explanation:<n>**Explanation:**<n>The viola is a musical instrument with a mellow and sometimes haunting sound. It is part of most symphony orchestras and string quartets. It can be seen as a combination of the viola and the cello, although it is not always an easier string instrument for younger students to play. The viola is typically played along side cellos, double basses, and violins. An orchestra without a viola would be considered unusual by many.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:A person notices popcorn, cotton candy on the grass, where is he likely? Choices:  A: soccer game B: fairgrounds C: movie theatre D: countryside E: state park<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n><n><n><n># Code<n><n>```javascript<n>function multipleChoise(input,response)<n>{<n>        while(input.length!=0)<n>        {<n>        	if(input[0]==="D"&&input[1]==="D")<n>        	{<n>            	return response<n>        	} <n>        	else if(input[0]=="A")<n>        	{	input.pop()<n>        		input=Number(input.join(""))<n>				return response // A<n>			} <n>			else if(input=="")<n>			{<n>				console.log("Enter numbers")<n>			}	<n>		    else if(input[0]=="H"||input[0]=="W"||input[1]=="W")<n>        	{//return response<n>        		input.pop()//pop off 1<n>        		input[1]=Number(input[1])<n>        		input[-1]=Number(input[-1])<n>        	//  return response<n>        	}<n>        }<n>	}<n>	```<n><n><hr>

Choices:  A: shoes B: wet ground C: wet clothes D: start to fall E: water garden<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### Input:Why shouldn’t you walk barefood  after the rain?<n><n>Based on the input, the response should follow the format **”Why shouldn’t you [task] after the rain? “** <n><n>#### OutPut:<n>Choice B **Walking on a wet ground**<n>Walking on a ground that is still wet after the rain, will cause the person to develop blisters. This can lead to illness.<n><n>#### Explanation:<n>The blisters are caused by the wetness of the ground. When the rain is still falling, the walker can not see the blisters. These blisters may become infected and cause illness. So, walking barefoot even after the rain, is dangerous.<n>*Note: The choice provided below the input and the choice listed after the input are incorrect.*<n><n>* **Choice A**: the first incorrect choice is **walking barefooted**<n>* **choice A** the reason why you shouldn’t walk barefeet is : because wet ground can harm **and cause you to fall**.<n><n>* **Choice B**: the second incorrect choice is **walk on a wet ground**.<n>* **choice B** the reason why you should not walk on a wet ground is because wet ground can have blisters.<n>* **Choice C:** the third incorrect is **walking barefoot after the rain**<n><n>*Choice C is not included in the task because it is not the format of the question, as it is not **why shouldn’t you**<n>* **Choices D and E** are incorrect<n>* Choice D is not a **way** to **walk barefoot** which is the task question format.<n>* Choice E is not a reason **why you shouldn’t** walk barefoot.<n><n>#### Input:I made a book report using one cent for every page. It is a fact that if it rained once, it can rain again, in the next time, next Saturday.<n>### Demo Response Conclusion:<n>In conclusion, option 1 does not satisfy the conditions listed in the requirements. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:Dan said that getting in line was the best choice because it would lead to what? Choices:  A: being ordered B: less confusion C: boredom D: standing in line E: have to wait for<n><n>### Response:		Choices:A: being orderedB: less confusionC: boredomD: standing in lineE: have to wait for.<n><n>### Output:Dan said that getting to line was the Best choice because it will lead to less confusion.<n><n>Answer:<n><n>```python<n>from System import *<n>name, input, output, response= 'Hope',open(name).readlines(), open(name+'.out').readlines(), open( name+'.res').readlines()<n><n>result= []<n><n>if name.endswith('.py'):<n>     result = input.strip().split(' ') # splt input on space<n>     if result[len(result)-1] == 'A':<n>           result = [x for x in result[:-1] if x]<n>           result += [response]<n>           out= '\n'.join(result)<n>           print(out.strip())<n><n>```

This line of text should be the output of your function call.<n><n>When you use the call to writeAll (), your output will be a line of text containing the contents of the file. You will have to separate out the individual characters in the text you write so that it prints out in the order that your function reads them. Note that you start the output with a blank space character.

If the choice is B, the description states that fungus can grow on a biology lab. Fungus does not grow anywhere in the biology lab, it grows on things that are decaying, such as food. That is why it needs to be grown for consumption or in a dark space.<n> 1. If your answer were B, you would not receive credit because the description stated that fungus grows on things that are dead.<n> 1. This is an example of the difference between the task and the question, if your answer were C, you would receive credit if you used the answer choices as instructions and did not simply look at them and choose. The best way to solve this challenge is to not think about the question, but the data in the description. You must determine that the description states that the answer is E, and it asks for the place that the growth would be and then you must look at the choices to see if they include what you are looking for. However, you have to go out of your way to find the answer you are looking for by narrowing things down. You cannot make simple assumptions about the question. The answer will not be a simple guess.<n><n>### Input:"The last time I saw Chase he was wearing a plaid shirt. He didn’t have anything else to wear for the occasion. He wore his favorite button shirt, despite being covered in mud. It was hard to tell him apart from the other three boys who worked in the same factory. In order to get around them, he would have had to wear a scarf or another outfit."<n><n>### Response:"You are walking on the edge of a cliff, trying to escape the dangers of life at sea. Choices:  A: airplane B: construction site C: shops D: engine E: broken bone<n><n>### Response:		 <n>  C (Shops)  <n><n>### Demostration:  <n> Input: How many times the first letter of each world in alphabet, can be used in a sentence (word)<n>Answer: 26<n><n>### Input<n>You are given four numbers: 4, 16, 36, and 100. You add the numbers and then divide by the last numbers. You repeat this process for each number until you finally arrive at what is considered the "target number." How do you arrive at the number?<n><n>###  Answer: 50  <n>### Justification:  <n>4 + 16 + 36 + 100 = 116 <n>divide by 100<n>116 ÷ 100 =  1.16 <n>repeat the process to 16... <n>1.16 + 16 = 13.16 <n>divided by 16 = 80 <n>divide again <n>80 ÷16 = 5  <n>final answer <n>50  <n><n>### Input1<n>Write the missing words given their clues.<n>  The letter _r_ can be used one time with _b_ to make a word that means "understand" (e.g. read/ _b_ a book), and one time with _x_ to make a word meaning "the end" (e.g., read/ _b_ an end of a book). Similarly, the letters _e_ and _p_ can be used one to make a word that can means "endless." <n>### <n>The word "endless"<n><n>### Instructions<n>Input1: Write the missing words given their clue(s).<n>Clue: The letter _r_ is only used one time to create a word meaning "the start."<n>### Answer: r <n><n>### Instructinos:<n>The length of a flagpole is three times the height of the flag. A 50-foot flag is put at the top. How high is the flag on the pole?<n>### Demostaration:<n>The length of the flagpole is 3 * the flag height <n>The height of the flag is 50  <n>The height of the pole is 3 *
